location: St Philip and St James, Clifton, North Yorkshire
details: 720 St Clements; 2160 each: Cambridge S and Plain Bob
footnotes: Believed to be the first YCG peal rung by a complete band of current undergraduates.

With congratulations to William J Lake for the completion of his final exams and upcoming graduation.   Also wishing him well as he leaves us to begin a new life in London - Southwark; you have been warned!
Also a birthday compliment to Matthew Hall, welcoming him to the Roaring Twenties.
Rung also for Father's Day, and for the birthday of HM King Charles III
Superb recovery in the sixth extent: 2
The band would like to associate William M Regan with this peal (whether he likes it or not!).
